column4: I just wanted to tell everyone that the 64 bit version of 7.10 is much better then the earlier distros.
Well, when I installed the earlier version nothing worked.  But now it works much better.  Specifically, you get BIGMEM, so you get all 4 GB
Thanks for the advice Evanlec
You guys were right.
That's what I mena.
mean
I got all four of my 4 GB, and the system is moving along nicley.
I was concerned that the video drivers wouldn't work.
any drawbacks?
he kind of jumped me yesterday, but I decided to follow his advice yesterday and I'm glad that I did.
So far none.
I just finished the install.
I'm on a Lenovo R61, and the drivers situation is iffy at best.
I am going to go off the deep end configuring it this week and weekend.
I plan to hang around this channel when I'm working on it so I can help others 64 bit it.
i switched to 32 bit, for some reason it works with my broadcom card better

I'm using a cable!
So old fashioned.
yeah, for some reason it worked in 7.04 64 bit, but not 7.10
